notes.title: Highest Individual Score
notes.content: Rohit Sharma holds the record for the highest individual ODI score with 264 runs against Sri Lanka in 2014.

notes.title: Most Test Wickets
notes.content: Muttiah Muralitharan took 800 wickets in Test matches — the highest by any bowler in cricket history.

notes.title: Sachin's Centuries
notes.content: Sachin Tendulkar is the only player to score 100 international centuries (51 in Tests and 49 in ODIs).

notes.title: First Cricket World Cup
notes.content: The first Cricket World Cup was held in 1975 and was won by the West Indies.

notes.title: Arsenal Invincibles
notes.content: Arsenal went unbeaten in the entire 2003–04 Premier League season, earning the nickname 'The Invincibles'.

notes.title: Arsenal's Home Ground
notes.content: Arsenal plays at the Emirates Stadium in North London, which opened in 2006.

notes.title: Thierry Henry Legacy
notes.content: Thierry Henry is Arsenal’s all-time leading goalscorer with 228 goals across all competitions.

notes.title: Arsène Wenger Era
notes.content: Arsène Wenger managed Arsenal from 1996 to 2018, making him the club’s longest-serving manager.

notes.title: FA Cup Kings
notes.content: Arsenal holds the record for most FA Cup wins with 14 titles as of 2023.
